member.name: T:KiteConnect.Kite
member.summary: The API client class. In production, you may initialize a single instance of this class per `APIKey`.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Net.WebProxy,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize a new Kite Connect client instance.
member.param: The token obtained after the login flow in exchange for the `RequestToken` . Pre-login, this will default to None,but once you have obtained it, you should persist it in a database or session to pass to the Kite Connect class initialisation for subsequent requests.
API end point root. Unless you explicitly want to send API requests to a non-default endpoint, this can be ignored.
If set to True, will serialise and print requests and responses to stdout.
Time in milliseconds for which the API client will wait for a request to complete before it fails
To set proxy for http request. Should be an object of WebProxy.
Number of connections to server. Client will reuse the connections if they are alive.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.SetSessionHook(System.Action)
member.summary: Set a callback hook for session (`TokenError` -- timeout, expiry etc.) errors. An `AccessToken` (login session) can become invalid for a number of reasons, but it doesn't make sense for the client to try and catch it during every API call. A callback method that handles session errors can be set here and when the client encounters a token error at any point, it'll be called. This callback, for instance, can log the user out of the UI, clear session cookies, or initiate a fresh login.
member.param: Action to be invoked when session becomes invalid.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.SetAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Set the `AccessToken` received after a successful authentication.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetLoginURL
member.summary: Get the remote login url to which a user should be redirected to initiate the login flow.
member.returns: Login url to authenticate the user.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.RequestAccessToken(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Do the token exchange with the `RequestToken` obtained after the login flow, and retrieve the `AccessToken` required for all subsequent requests.The response contains not just the `AccessToken`, but metadata for the user who has authenticated.
member.param: Token obtained from the GET paramers after a successful login redirect.
API secret issued with the API key.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.InvalidateToken(System.String)
member.summary: Kill the session by invalidating the access token
member.param: Access token to invalidate. Default is the active access token.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.Margins(System.String)
member.summary: Get account balance and cash margin details for a particular segment.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.PlaceOrder(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Place an order
member.param: Margin product applied to the order (margin is blocked based on this)
Quantity to disclose publicly (for equity trades)
Price difference at which the order should be squared off and profit booked (eg: Order price is 100. Profit target is 102. So squareoff_value = 2)
Stoploss difference at which the order should be squared off (eg: Order price is 100. Stoploss target is 98. So stoploss_value = 2)
Incremental value by which stoploss price changes when market moves in your favor by the same incremental value from the entry price (optional)
You can place orders of varieties; regular orders, after market orders, cover orders etc.
An optional tag to apply to an order to identify it (alphanumeric, max 8 chars)
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.ModifyOrder(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Modify an open order.
member.param: Id of the order to be modified
Id of the parent order (obtained from the /orders call) as BO is a multi-legged order
Margin product applied to the order (margin is blocked based on this)
Quantity to disclose publicly (for equity trades)
You can place orders of varieties; regular orders, after market orders, cover orders etc.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.CancelOrder(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Cancel an order
member.param: Id of the order to be cancelled
You can place orders of varieties; regular orders, after market orders, cover orders etc.
Id of the parent order (obtained from the /orders call) as BO is a multi-legged order
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetOrders
member.summary: Gets the collection of orders from the orderbook.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetOrder(System.String)
member.summary: Gets information about given OrderId.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetTrades(System.String)
member.summary: Retreive the list of trades executed (all or ones under a particular order). An order can be executed in tranches based on market conditions. These trades are individually recorded under an order.
member.param: is the ID of the order (optional) whose trades are to be retrieved. If no `order_id` is specified, all trades for the day are returned.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetPositions
member.summary: Retrieve the list of positions.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetHoldings
member.summary: Retrieve the list of equity holdings.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.ModifyProduct(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Modify an open position's product type.
member.param: Existing margin product of the position
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetInstruments(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve the list of market instruments available to trade. Note that the results could be large, several hundred KBs in size, with tens of thousands of entries in the list.
member.returns: Json response in the form of array of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetQuote(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve quote and market depth for an instrument.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetOHLC(System.String[])
member.summary: Retrieve LTP and OHLC of upto 200 instruments
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetLTP(System.String[])
member.summary: Retrieve LTP of upto 200 instruments
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetHistorical(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieve historical data (candles) for an instrument.
member.param: Identifier for the instrument whose historical records you want to fetch. This is obtained with the instrument list API.
Date in format yyyy-mm-dd for fetching candles between two days. Date in format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss for fetching candles between two timestamps.
Date in format yyyy-mm-dd for fetching candles between two days. Date in format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss for fetching candles between two timestamps.
The candle record interval. Possible values are: minute, day, 3minute, 5minute, 10minute, 15minute, 30minute, 60minute
Pass true to get continous data of expired instruments.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetTriggerRange(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve the buy/sell trigger range for Cover Orders.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFInstruments
member.summary: Gets the Mutual funds Instruments.
member.returns: The Mutual funds Instruments.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFOrders
member.summary: Gets all Mutual funds orders.
member.returns: The Mutual funds orders.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFOrder(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the Mutual funds order by OrderId.
member.returns: The Mutual funds order.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.PlaceMFOrder(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Places a Mutual funds order.
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.
member.param: Amount worth of units to purchase. Not applicable on SELLs.
Quantity to SELL. Not applicable on BUYs. If the holding is less than minimum_redemption_quantity, all the units have to be sold.
An optional tag to apply to an order to identify it (alphanumeric, max 8 chars).

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.CancelMFOrder(System.String)
member.summary: Cancels the Mutual funds order.
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFSIPs
member.summary: Gets all Mutual funds SIPs.
member.returns: The list of all Mutual funds SIPs.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFSIP(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a single Mutual funds SIP by SIP id.
member.returns: The Mutual funds SIP.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.PlaceMFSIP(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Places a Mutual funds SIP order.
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.
member.param: Amount worth of units to purchase. It should be equal to or greated than minimum_additional_purchase_amount and in multiple of purchase_amount_multiplier in the instrument master.

Amount worth of units to purchase before the SIP starts. Should be equal to or greater than minimum_purchase_amount and in multiple of purchase_amount_multiplier. This is only considered if there have been no prior investments in the target fund.
If Frequency is monthly, the day of the month (1, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25) to trigger the order on.
Number of instalments to trigger. If set to -1, instalments are triggered at fixed intervals until the SIP is cancelled.
An optional tag to apply to an order to identify it (alphanumeric, max 8 chars).

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.ModifyMFSIP(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Modifies the Mutual funds SIP.
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.
member.param: Amount worth of units to purchase. It should be equal to or greated than minimum_additional_purchase_amount and in multiple of purchase_amount_multiplier in the instrument master.
If Frequency is monthly, the day of the month (1, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25) to trigger the order on.
Number of instalments to trigger. If set to -1, instalments are triggered idefinitely until the SIP is cancelled.
Pause or unpause an SIP (active or paused).

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.CancelMFSIP(System.String)
member.summary: Cancels the Mutual funds SIP.
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFHoldings
member.summary: Gets the Mutual funds holdings.
member.returns: The list of all Mutual funds holdings.

member.summary: Event triggered when ticker is connected

member.summary: Event triggered when ticker is disconnected

member.summary: Event triggered when ticker receives a tick

member.summary: Event triggered when ticker encounters an error

member.summary: Event triggered when ticker is reconnected

member.name: E:KiteConnect.Ticker.OnNoReconnect
member.summary: Event triggered when ticker is not reconnecting after failure

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize websocket client instance.
member.param: Zerodha client id of the authenticated user

Token obtained after the login flow in exchange for the `request_token`.Pre-login, this will default to None, but once you have obtained it, you should persist it in a database or session to pass to the Kite Connect class initialisation for subsequent requests.
Websocket API end point root. Unless you explicitly want to send API requests to a non-default endpoint, this can be ignored.
Enables WebSocket autreconnect in case of network failure/disconnection.
Interval (in seconds) between auto reconnection attemptes. Defaults to 5 seconds.
Maximum number reconnection attempts. Defaults to 50 attempts.

member.summary: Reads 2 byte short int from byte stream

member.summary: Reads 4 byte int32 from byte stream

member.summary: Close a WebSocket connection

member.summary: Reconnect WebSocket connection in case of failures

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.Subscribe(System.String[])
member.summary: Subscribe to a list of instrument_tokens.
member.param: List of instrument instrument_tokens to subscribe

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.UnSubscribe(System.String[])
member.summary: Unsubscribe the given list of instrument_tokens.
member.param: List of instrument instrument_tokens to unsubscribe

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.SetMode(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Set streaming mode for the given list of tokens.
member.param: List of instrument tokens on which the mode should be applied
Mode to set. It can be one of the following: ltp, quote, full.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.ReSubscribe
member.summary: Resubscribe to all currently subscribed tokens. Used to restore all the subscribed tokens after successful reconnection.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.EnableReconnect(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enable WebSocket autreconnect in case of network failure/disconnection.
member.param: Interval between auto reconnection attemptes. `onReconnect` callback is triggered when reconnection is attempted.
Maximum number reconnection attempts. Defaults to 50 attempts. `onNoReconnect` callback is triggered when number of retries exceeds this value.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.DisableReconnect
member.summary: Disable WebSocket autreconnect.
